bug.short_desc: Internationalization documentation is wrong and/or qx.locale does not correctly apply browser's locale

long_desc.thetext:
On page http://manual.qooxdoo.org/current/pages/development/internationalization.html#localization the description for locales uses examples of en_US and en_UK but following this will not correctly apply the locale because the locale must be specified in lower case.
If, in config.json, you set "let" / "LOCALES" to [ "en", "en_GB" ] and run generate.py, this code:
var locale = qx.locale.Manager.getInstance().getLocale(); this.debug("Locale=" + locale + ", dateFormat=" + qx.locale.Date.getDateFormat("short", locale));
will output: 001523 aftest.Application[26-0]: Locale=en_gb, dateFormat=M/d/yy
The date format should be dd/MM/yyyy.
If you change the LOCALES to [ "en", "en_gb" ] you get the correct date format for the GB locale.
In this, the generator appears to correctly select the locale ignoring case (it outputs "processing 3 locales" instead of 2), and the cdlr/main/*.xml files use mixed case.
Also, whether this is a bug in the docs or a bug in the code, the docs use en_UK as an example - which doesn't exist.

If you use lower case locale (eg "en_gb") then the generator cannot find the locale file when building on Linux (this bug report was based on behaviour on a Mac which has a case insensitive filing system), so you have to use "en_GB".
However, in qx.bom.client.Locale.__getNavigatorLocale() the locale that is detected from the browser is always converted to lowercase, but qx.locale.Manager treats locale's as case sensitive and the generator has provided the locale as "en_GB".
If you manually specify the locale as en_GB the date format is correct
